acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=33microg/L(mercury (II) nitrate concentration equivalent: 53microg/L) of fishes (Rainbow trout) (EHC86, 1989).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It is based on rat dermal LD50= 75mg/kg (RTECS, 2005).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50;VALUE:26mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: RTECS (2005)

carcinogenicity.rationale: As inorganic mercury compounds, it was out of the Category. Since it is classified into IARC Group 3 (IARC, 58, 1993) and ACGIH A4 (ACGIH-TLV, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and it is a metallic compound, behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Not Classified because of UNRTDG No. 1625, Class: 6.1, II and not explosive solely, though the substance contains N-O bonds as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present. (Reactions of the substance with several kinds of compounds such as acetylenes or ethanols lead to explosive products.)

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In ATSDR (1999), since it estimated that mercury and mercury compounds induced chromosomal abnormality to the animal somatic cell in an in vivo, they were set to Category 3.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 1625, Class: 6.1, PGII, though it is a strong oxidizing agent (ICSC(J), 2000; Sax, 11th, 2004).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since the effect on generating (California EPA, Proposition 65 List of Chemicals, 2005) and reproductive (ACGIH-TLV, 2004) was indicated as mercury and mercury compounds or inorganic mercuries, it was considered as Category 2.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Not classified based on UNRTDG No. 1625, Class: 6.1, PGII

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the descripiton of oculo corrosiveness (ICSC, 2000), and it is classified into Category 1 in description of skin corrosivenesses. So it was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale:
It was set as Category 1A-1C from the description with the possibility which indicated skin corrosivities (ICSC, 2000) and skin irritation to humans (DFGOT, vol.15, 2001[as inorganic mercury compounds]; HSFS, 1993).
[view] When subdivision needs to be performed, it is desirable to be seto as Category 1A from a viewpoint of safety.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Metal mercury and inorganic mercury compound (as Hg) were set to Category 1 from description with the possibility which there is skin sensitization (MAK/BAT, 2005; DFGOT, vol.15, 2001), and shows skin sensitization in ICSC (2000).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since in Priority 1 document, the effect on the central nervous systems and the kidneyto humans by inorganic mercury compounds was described (ACGIH-TLV, 2004;EHC, 118, 1991) , and the effect on the nervous system and the kidney  by the product was indicated in Priority 2 document (ICSC, 2000;SITTIG, 4th, 2002), it was classified into Category 1 (a central nervous systems, the kidney).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (kidney)
May cause damage to organs (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (kidneys) and Category 2 (respiratory organs) based on the reports concerning humans in Priority 1 documents that the target organs of the substance in the inorganic mercury compound are the kidneys (DFGOT, vol.15, 2001), and on the reports of the effects on the kidneys and airways corrosivity or respiratory organ irritant properties in Priority 2 documents (ICSC, 2000; HSFS, 1993; SITTIG, 4th, 2002).
